text: Roger Goodell's big payday rethinking
natural gas and Hades hidden waterfalls
good evening this is the New York Times
minute a big payday for NFL Commissioner
Roger Goodell last year he received 44
million dollars in compensation partly
inflated by a one-time bonus it puts him
on par with some of the best pay chief
executives but raises questions about
whether the NFL deserves to remain a
non-profit the league generates billions
in revenues but enjoys tax-exempt status
you've seen the ads but a new report
finds that running vehicles on natural
gas may be worse for the planet than
diesel the drilling and production of
natural gas can lead to methane leaks
which negates its benefits as a
transportation fuel and from the travel
section and unlikely destination in
Haiti Kaskade p shawn offers stunning
waterfalls the sort of natural wonder
that the country's hoping will make it a
top destination spot if you can get past
the widespread poverty would you be up
for that type of adventure
